content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A marketing director for a beverage company conducted a study to investigate people’s soda preferences in two regions of the country. The director selected a random sample of <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> people from the east coast and a random sample of <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> people from the west coast to survey. The responses are summarized in the following table. East Coast West Coast Regular soda <math alttext="44"><mstyle><mrow><mn>44</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="37"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Diet soda <math alttext="39"><mstyle><mrow><mn>39</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="42"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> No preference <math alttext="17"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="21"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Total <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Do the data provide convincing statistical evidence, at the level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, that the preferences are different between the two regions of the country? Complete the appropriate inference procedure to support your answer.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A marketing director for a beverage company conducted a study to investigate people’s soda preferences in two regions of the country. The director selected a random sample of <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> people from the east coast and a random sample of <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> people from the west coast to survey. The responses are summarized in the following table. East Coast West Coast Regular soda <math alttext="44"><mstyle><mrow><mn>44</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="37"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Diet soda <math alttext="39"><mstyle><mrow><mn>39</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="42"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> No preference <math alttext="17"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="21"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Total <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Do the data provide convincing statistical evidence, at the level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, that the preferences are different between the two regions of the country? Complete the appropriate inference procedure to support your answer.

topic.text: 8.5: Setting Up a Chi-Square Test for Homogeneity or Independence

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
